abstract: Both CIT an GE Capital cling to business models that no longer work in that the market for short-term financing has virtually dried up.
snippet: Both CIT an GE Capital cling to business models that no longer work in that the market for short-term financing has virtually dried up.
lead_paragraph: From the numbers, it sure is hard to spot the difference between General Electric’s financial arm and CIT, the lender facing a refinancing crisis as soon as next month.

headline.main: Lenders in Need of Financial Help
headline.print_headline: Lenders in Need of Financial Help

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Robert Cyran
